title: Jang Ha-na Wins Inaugural LGPA Event in Busan
text:
Coming into the fourth and final round in third place, Jang scored an eagle, six birdies and a bogey to finish at the top with a 19-under 269 overall. Kang, who started the final round in fourth place, shot eight birdies to tie for the lead with Jang.

Jang Ha-na won the inaugural BMW Ladies Championship in Busan on Sunday after a nailbiting finale against Korean-American Danielle Kang.

The two close friends and rivals went into a playoff, and Jang birdied the third hole to beat Kang, who parred, and collected US$300,000.

The championship at the LPGA International Busan is an LPGA event launched for the first time in Korea.

It was the fifth LPGA victory in about two years for Jang, who left the U.S. tour to return to the Korean tour in June 2017.

She achieved the victory while battling with a hairline stress fracture in her foot that she sustained en route to winning her season's first KLPGA title at the Hana Financial Group Championship on Oct. 6. She had to withdraw from a pair of majors after that due to the injury.

World No. 1 Ko Jin-young finished tied for ninth with a 10 under. But she was named the winner of the LPGA Rolex Player of the Year award regardless of the results of the three remaining events of the season.

She is the fourth Korean golfer to receive the honor, following Park In-bee (2013), Ryu So-yeon (2017) and Park Sung-hyun (2017).
description: Jang Ha-na Wins Inaugural LGPA Event in Busan
